sn9.7:4.1: At one time Venerable Nāgadatta was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
sn9.7:4.2: Now at that time Venerable Nāgadatta had been entering the village too early and returning late in the day.
sn9.7:4.3: Then the deity haunting that forest had compassion for Nāgadatta, wanting what’s best for him. So they approached him wanting to stir him up,
sn9.7:5.2: and returning after spending too much of the day,
sn9.7:6.1: I’m afraid for Nāgadatta; he’s so reckless
sn9.7:6.3: May he not come under the King of Death’s power,
sn9.7:6.4: under the sway of the Terminator!”
sn9.7:7.1: Stirred up by that deity, Venerable Nāgadatta came to his senses.
